items.content_html: So when we bought the Q5 2 1/2 years ago what I didn‚Äôt realise was that although bluetooth was available in the car, Audi had decided that it would restrict where. Specifically music couldn‚Äôt stream that way. It‚Äôs taken me this long to resolve the issue with an overpriced dingus.

Following up from my previous post, sometimes you need some bad sleep for you to work out what‚Äôs already in your head. Ryan decided not to sleep tonight, but my brain kicked into overdrive this morning and I‚Äôve settled on the style I‚Äôm trying to achieve. LOTS of art to come!

Well that didn‚Äôt go as planned. I‚Äôve been working on a piece of art for my new project all weekend and completed 85%. When I finally had a look at it in it‚Äôs intended medium (email), I realised it was too busy and complicated. Back to the drawing board I guess.
Because one sketch deserves another‚Ä¶
More sketches.
It‚Äôs iPhone X, or iPhone XS day! After 4 years I think I‚Äôm finally due for an upgrade.
First attempt at using my new style with architectural style backgrounds - always the intention really.
Learning how to draw and sketch in ways different to what I‚Äôm used to. First up, cars!

Fell down a massive hole that is Udemy. Never heard of it before and stumbled on it by accident while looking for resources for sketching like an architect. Found a great course and then proceeded to buy a whole bunch more.

üé• So the wife and I finally watched a movie together. We settled on Tully. Great movie. It will hit different people in different ways. It hit my wife the hardest being a mother of a 4 year old and 8 month old. Diablo Codi is one of my favourite writers in Hollywood.

üáØüáµ Hadn‚Äôt realised the extent of the destruction on Japan this summer. I have a huge soft spot in my mind and heart for the country. I truly wish them the best in what seems to be a never ending assault of natural disasters.

So the new upload function on Micro.blog is pretty awesome. Especially considering it works for gifs as well. The new Maus from Lofree is another design win from a company who‚Äôs really been killing it as bringing 1950s stylings to modern technology.
So I discovered Tadama today. Probably the most elegant and simple pomodoro app on the Mac.

üèÄ A month ago I went to the basketball court and nearly died from the humidity. Which idiot decides to go play bball when it‚Äôs 95% humidity? This idiot. Anyway, today attempted the same thing again and can happily confirm that the worst is behind us and it‚Äôs now bball weather.
Ok someone tell me why it‚Äôs taken this long for someone (thanks bro) to tell me about The Weeknd and the Starboy album? You‚Äôre welcome, pass on the love.
Use the negative energy you have to build something rather than mope around.
Everything is a remix. This article on the inspiration behind Monument Valley‚Äôs levels is a great peak inside the process.

So now that Sunlit 2.2 has been released, I‚Äôm considering jettisoning myself from Instagram. The only missing feature for me is the ability to my photos as a collection of thumbnails (in the app or online). Hopefully that will come in future iterations.

I just read Khaled Hosseini‚Äôs Sea Prayer, and honestly haven‚Äôt cried this much since Alan Kurdi‚Äôs image was burned into my head. My oldest was roughly the same age. The whole thing just breaks my brain and emotions in countless ways.
UGhhh. Came back to my car, parking sensor in the rear had popped in. Need to find a way to pull this thing back in place without removing the whole rear bumper‚Ä¶YouTube?

Yesterday I asked for an alternative to Tinyletter and Buttondown was recommended. Having spent a day kicking the tires, this now joins a small pantheon of indie web services that I want to support. Need an email service that can join Pinboard, Micro.blog, Feedbin and Buttondown.

Does anyone have a suggestion for a good alternative to Tinyletter, that is similar in minimal functionality but is possibly paid? I‚Äôm having trouble sorting something out there and I‚Äôve read that eventually MailChimp will be closing the service down‚Ä¶

Affinity Publisher Beta is out today! I‚Äôve been waiting for a long time for this. With both Photo and Designer becoming my go to apps for digital creative work, this is the last piece of the puzzle. So excited.

Finally pressed the trigger on a particular part of my latest project - this is a long term endeavour but it begins with this very small step. I‚Äôll be hammering through some details over the weekend and hopefully try and release it out into the big bad world soon.

Paul turned me onto Russell Brand‚Äôs podcast Under The Skin. I‚Äôm halfway through episode 03 with Adam Curtis and have the same feeling I do when I get through an issue of the Economist. Even Brand‚Äôs accent (not a fan) can‚Äôt hide the smartness and thoughtfulness on display.
